problem.p: An engineer is considering using a column with one of the cross-sections shown below, A or B. Assuming the cross-sections have the same total cross-sectional area, which will make a stronger column assuming the column will fail by buckling?

img.alt: (A) smaller square solid column or (B) larger square hollow column

choicegroup.label: An engineer is considering using a column with one of the cross-sections shown below, A or B. Assuming the cross-sections have the same total area, which will make a stronger column?

div.p: The hollow cross-section will have a higher moment of inertia since more of the area is away from the center thus will carry a higher load. If the columns were to fail in compression both would be equally strong since the cross-sectional area is the same.
